title: $34,000 solid gold debit card offered to shoppers
text:
London | A solid gold debit card is being offered to customers through Britain's Royal Mint.

The 18-carat hallmarked debit cards will be personalised for account holders "who value high-quality luxury items that make a statement".

Britain’s Royal Mint has produced a solid gold payment card — and you’ll need to fork out £18,750 ($34,300) to buy one. Royal Mint

People wanting to get their hands on one need to pay £18,750 ($34,300) for a card, or more for bespoke and personalised designs.

They have been developed by the Mint in conjunction with Mastercard and payments technology firm Accomplish Financial.

The cards, which are part of an account called Raris, will be personalised for customers, with their name and signature directly engraved into the precious metal.
